text: Reminder: FEMA & the FCC will be conducting a TEST of the Emergency Alert System and Wireless Emergency Alerts later today at approximately 2:20pm. Learn more here: fema.gov/press-release/20231…

.@SpeakerMcCarthy has conducted the House in the most transparent and inclusive manner of any Speaker I have served under. He is doing an exceptional job leading our caucus and achieving our priorities. There is no one better suited and able to lead the @HouseGOP.
Miss the latest edition of my e-newsletter? Read it here and be sure to sign up to receive the next one! iqconnect.house.gov/iqextran…
Congratulations to the Lancaster Barnstormers on their back-to-back Atlantic League Championship victories!

I voted again to ensure our troops and border patrol agents are paid. Today’s bill allows the House to continue the appropriations process through regular order. I will continue advocating for fiscal discipline, creating a bipartisan fiscal commission, and securing our border.

I voted to pay our troops, reduce government spending, secure our border, and create a bipartisan fiscal commission which I believe is a critical step to addressing America’s $33 trillion in debt. 

I will also instruct the Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives to withhold my pay in the event of a shutdown.

My full statement: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

Accountability for federal child welfare program funds is critical, but onerous regulations require local programs to have many employees for admin functions limiting resources that could be supporting families. My comments from today’s @WaysandMeansGOP subcommittee hearing:

PA-11 is the Commonwealth’s top agricultural district. I appreciated meeting with @PAAgriculture Sec. Russell Redding today to discuss supporting dairy farmers, addressing the Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI), and conservation programs for the Chesapeake watershed.

Today in 1777, the Continental Congress met in Lancaster in the old courthouse, before adjourning to travel across the Susquehanna River to York. Lancaster and York played important roles in our nation’s history! Learn more: history.state.gov/department…

I want to thank the thousands of #PA11 residents who joined me for a telephone town hall earlier this week. I appreciated your questions and comments. Listen to Felton resident Elizabeth’s question about the high cost of living.

A big thank you to Tom Summers of York County, for his 68 years of service to the New Freedom community as a member of the Lions Club, for his decade of service as a borough council member, and his dedication volunteering with countless other organizations.
I hope our friends and neighbors observing Yom Kippur have an easy and meaningful fast.
If you’re experiencing an issue with a federal department or agency, please contact my office. We’re here to help. Learn more by visiting my website: smucker.house.gov/services/h…
This week I joined WDAC to discuss my proposal to create a bipartisan debt commission as well as needed reforms to federal workforce development programs. Listen in!
Thanks to @PAORTHOSOCIETY member Dr. Suzette Song of York County, for meeting to discuss issues impacting orthopaedic surgeons and health care providers like prior authorization.

Needless bureaucracy shouldn’t prevent exceptional educational institutions like @ThaddeusStevens from participating in federal workforce development programs under WIOA. We must improve this program. Listen to my questions and comments from a recent @EdWorkforceCmte hearing.
Thanks to members of the @P_M_T_A for visiting to discuss workforce development policies and my Main Street Tax Certainty Act.

I want to thank Angie of Lititz, a volunteer with @ACSCANPA for visiting with me in Washington and sharing her story and perspective about the importance of early detection and supporting NIH research to find a cure.

America is $33 trillion in debt. Our fiscal trajectory is bleak and if we do not act, our debt-to-GDP ratio nearly doubles by 2053. I’m thankful the @housebudgetGOP budget includes my proposal for a bipartisan debt commission. Listen to my remarks:
It was great to meet with Jaclyn Weaber, from Pennsy Supply in York County, about workforce development policies during CRH America’s Women’s Impact Group visit to Washington.
This is an awful tragedy. Our prayers are with President Epps’ family, friends, and the Temple community during this difficult time.  wgal.com/article/philadelphi…

Flawed implementation of the No Surprises Act may be having significant impacts on patients' access to care in rural communities, like those in PA-11. Listen to my questions and comments from today’s @WaysandMeansGOP Committee hearing.
Happy 76th Birthday to the United States Air Force!
Miss the latest edition of my e-newsletter? Read it here and be sure to sign up to receive the next one! iqconnect.house.gov/iqextran…

Today is Constitution Day, marking the signing of the Constitution in Philadelphia on September 17, 1787.

“We the People of the United States, in Order to form a more perfect Union, [...] do ordain and establish this Constitution for the United States of America.”

The latest edition of my e-newsletter will be sent later today, sign up now to make sure you receive the latest news from Washington, DC and around the district delivered to your inbox! smucker.house.gov/contact/ne…

Will Kiefer and the team at the Bench Mark Program in Lancaster are making a positive impact on students’ lives. Thanks for the opportunity to visit and learn about how your mentorship programs are making a difference.
Thanks to Julie of Feeding Pennsylvania and Ryan of Central Pennsylvania Food Bank for meeting with me in Washington to discuss policies included in the Farm Bill.
Shana Tova to all of our friends celebrating Rosh Hashanah!
Thanks to Julie from Fawn Grove and other representatives of the Pennsylvania Farm Bureau for meeting with me to discuss important priorities for our community in the Farm Bill.
Today is National POW/MIA Recognition Day. May we always remember and honor those members of the United States Armed Forces who were prisoners of war or are missing in action.

New estimates suggest that $135 billion in pandemic-era unemployment insurance benefits were fraudulent. Earlier this year @HouseGOP passed the Protecting Taxpayers and Victims of Unemployment Fraud Act to address this massive theft of taxpayer dollars. thecentersquare.com/national…
Bidenflation continues to take its toll on American families’ budgets. foxbusiness.com/economy/cpi-…

This week is National Truck Driver Appreciation Week! Be sure to give thanks for the efforts of drivers at nearly 69,000 trucking companies in PA, to keep our economy on the move.

I’d also like to thank the @P_M_T_A for their support of my Main Street Tax Certainty Act!

Today marks the 22nd anniversary of the attacks of September 11, 2001. We must always remember and honor those we lost that day, their families, and give thanks to those who ran into danger to save others.
If you’re experiencing an issue with a federal department or agency, please contact my office. We’re here to help. Learn more by visiting my website: smucker.house.gov/services/h…
I joined WDAC this week to discuss legislation I’m supporting to help stop the spread of the spotted lanternfly and provide and update on the 2023 Farm Bill. Listen in!
It was great to visit @GenHydroinc in Lancaster to visit their headquarters and learn about their technology and innovation with hydrogen. Thanks for a great visit!
I joined RJ Harris on WHP580 earlier this week to discuss the news that our nation’s deficit is projected to climb to $2 trillion this year.
Fall is almost here now that August is in the rearview mirror. Watch my August in Review video where I recap my travels across the district!
It was great to be with members of the Lancaster County Association of Realtors to discuss federal policies impacting housing affordability.

I want to thank Ruby Jones of Lancaster County for meeting with me to discuss ways to improve federal nutrition assistance programs by providing increased nutritional education, as well her work leading Perish No More Ministries to support individuals struggling with addiction.
It was great to speak with the Rotary Club of York today about my Main Street Tax Certainty Act and the state of our nation’s finances. Thanks for your thoughtful questions and warm welcome!
It was great to visit Shank’s Extracts, a Universal company, in Lancaster County. This business, founded in 1899, is a leading provider of vanilla extracts. Thanks for a great visit!
Wishing everyone a relaxing and great Labor Day!
Thanks to Jenna, Janelle, and Amber for meeting with me to discuss federal policies, legislation, and regulations in the cosmetics industry.
The latest edition of my e-newsletter will be sent to inboxes later today, sign up now to receive the latest news! smucker.house.gov/contact/ne…
Thanks to Krissy and her mother Marilyn for meeting with me to discuss Social Security’s survivor benefit policies. I greatly appreciated you sharing your stories with me.
Thanks to Brian and Jeff of the Go Big Small Biz Network for meeting with me to discuss issues impacting small businesses. Thanks for visiting!
A vibrant agricultural economy is critical to rural communities across #PA11. I joined the @YCEAPA for a roundtable discussion on how to strengthen our rural economy.
Thanks to Jean Summers, of Patriotic Stitchers, for visiting with me in Lancaster to discuss how the organization supports area veterans. Thanks to Jean and all the volunteers for all they do!

I appreciated visiting @WGAL’s studios in Lancaster for a behind-the-scenes tour with station President & General Manager Cindy DeLuca. Tune into WGAL tonight to watch my interview with @BarbaraBarrWGAL! 📺

It was great to join Penn State Health’s Recfest 2023 at Spooky Nook Sports Complex last weekend. This program offered demonstrations of adaptive sports and provided additional information for individuals of all ages and abilities. I appreciated the opportunity to play with members of the Central PA Phenom Wheelchair Rugby team! Thanks to Penn State Health and all the volunteers who worked hard to put together this great community event.
Happy Birthday to @FUNatDW! This kingdom for kids in Lancaster County was founded by Earl Clark and has been a place where families have made memories for 60 years. Best wishes for continued success!
If you’re experiencing an issue with a federal department or agency, please contact my office. We’re here to help. Learn more by visiting my website: smucker.house.gov/services/h…
I joined WDAC this week to discuss my travels across the district and growing support for my Main Street Tax Certainty Act. Listen in!
It was sweet to get a behind-the-scenes look at how Twizzlers are manufactured in Lancaster County! Thanks to the @HersheyCompany for the tour!

I want to thank the YWCA of Lancaster for the good work they do in our community and am thankful that they received federal funding to support survivors. Partnerships like this between the YWCA and @CAPLancaster strengthen our community. ywcalancaster.org/2023/08/10…
2/2: I am honored to receive @ABCKeystone’s Champion of the Merit Shop Award in recognition of my legislative efforts to support our nation’s free enterprise system.
1/2: It was great to visit MODLOGIQ, a commercial modular manufacturer, in New Holland to learn about their business and discuss federal workforce policies.
It’s fair season! Congratulations to the Elizabethtown Fair on your 50th anniversary! It was an honor to join the opening ceremonies and chat with Mayor Chuck Mummert earlier this week.

As stewards of the land, farmers want clean water and sustainable agriculture for future generations. It’s great to see @HersheyCompany and the @EPA work together in a private-public partnership to support local dairy farmers’ efforts to improve conservation efforts.

There are great things happening in Denver Borough. I enjoyed visiting small businesses along Main Street with Mayor Rod Redcay! I also appreciated meeting with local leaders from Denver, Adamstown, East Cocalico Township & @CocalicoSD Superintendent Dr. Ella Musser.
When small businesses thrive, our communities thrive. Learn more about my Main Street Tax Certainty Act: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…
10/10 - We are here to help. It would be an honor to assist you. Please contact any of my offices if we may be of service.

9/10 - We’ve helped to return over $44 million to constituents in the form of owed Social Security benefits, tax refunds, and more. However, we cannot guarantee an individual will like the response or answer they receive.
8/10 - Since 2017, my office has assisted over 11,000 constituents experiencing issues with federal departments or agencies.
7/10 - We will always advocate on your behalf and we will always keep your personal information confidential. And we will never disclose or work with an agency without your permission.
6/10 - To be clear, my office will always be available and will work diligently to assist constituents with issues they’re experiencing with federal departments or agencies.

5/10 - Instead, the LNP dedicated column inches and staff resources to reporting about an individual who is not personally impacted by an issue some have experienced with the USPS.
 
My office has assisted every individual who contacted us for assistance with this specific issue.

4/10 - My office has repeatedly offered to editors and staff writers the opportunity to discuss how my office works every day to assist constituents with issues they are experiencing with federal departments or agencies.
3/10 - Their new ownership has an opportunity to change that and become a successful publication, but is unlikely to happen as long as they keep their current editors.

2/10 - This article is their latest attempt in their continued efforts to attack my character and spread their false narratives. They remain out of touch with the greater Lancaster community and it shows.
1/10 - The failed LNP+LancasterOnline once again did not tell the whole story. Their bias remains on full display.

Biden’s inflation has busted families’ budgets. “The typical American household spent $709 more in July than they did two years ago to buy the same goods and services...” cnn.com/2023/08/11/economy/i…
Thanks to the @PAChamber for their support of my Main Street Tax Certainty Act!

Attention Students in PA-11: the Congressional App Challenge is open for registration! Middle and high school students can learn more about the competition and register teams here: congressionalappchallenge.us

Reminder: If you’re even considering international travel, do not delay applying for or renewing your passport. Processing times for expedited service are 7-9 weeks and routine service is 10-13 weeks. Do not delay, apply today: travel.state.gov/content/tra…

I appreciated the opportunity to meet with local leaders from York Township, Dallastown Borough, Yoe Borough, and the Dallastown School District to provide an update on what’s happening in Washington and discuss community initiatives.
Thank you to everyone at Garrety Glass in Dallastown for a great visit to learn about your business and discuss federal workforce and tax policies.
I appreciated the opportunity to visit The Potter’s House to learn more about their work supporting individuals in addiction recovery. Thanks for a great visit!
I had a great time visiting Giant Pharmacy in Ephrata to learn more about how they serve the community and to discuss prescription drug pricing.

Family farming is a strong tradition in PA-11. That’s true of Perrydell Farm & Dairy in York. I appreciated visiting Perrydell with the @YCEAPA to learn about their farm’s history and their milk bottling operation. Best wishes for continued success!
Thanks to Jonna and the team at the Leader Heights Animal Hospital for a behind-the-scenes tour to learn how you help keep our furry friends and family members healthy!

I want to thank Navy veteran David Strauser of York for his service to our nation. My office was able to assist David in receiving his National Defense Service Medal, which he earned while serving our nation during the Vietnam War.
Today is National Purple Heart Day which recognizes all those who received the Purple Heart during their selfless service to our nation.
I appreciated the opportunity to speak with the @Lanc_Chamber Advocacy Committee to discuss my Main Street Tax Certainty Act. Thank you for your support!
If you’re experiencing an issue with a federal department or agency, please contact my office. We’re here to help. Learn more by visiting my website: smucker.house.gov/services/h…

It was an honor to visit with veteran residents in Lancaster at the Hamilton Arms Center this week to honor them for their service and to discuss federal policies impacting long-term care providers with Compassus. Thanks to these veterans for their service!
Happy 233rd Birthday to the United States Coast Guard, thank you for all you do to serve our nation!

July is in the books and soon summer will turn to fall. Watch my July in Review video to learn more about how my Main Street Tax Certainty Act will help small businesses grow, create jobs, and invest in their communities.

I am thankful for the strong support for my Main Street Tax Certainty Act, which will help small businesses grow, create jobs, and invest in their communities. Read more about what local leaders are saying: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

I appreciated meeting with the leaders of Penn Medicine Lancaster General Health, Penn State Health, and WellSpan Health for a discussion about how federal health policy impacts our local providers who work to keep our communities healthy.
2/2- I appreciated our discussion about how federal policies can further support our farmers and improve our environment.
1/2- I enjoyed visiting an Amish-operated farm in Lancaster County today to learn more about the great conservation efforts on farms across our community in partnership with the @AllianceForBay

Thanks to James and Melissa of Union Community Care for meeting with me in Lancaster today to share an update on the great things happening at their organization and to discuss policies impacting federally qualified health centers.

I appreciated meeting with Dr. Jim Boyle of York to discuss federal regulatory, workforce, and other issues impacting dentists. Thanks for stopping by!
It was great to discuss federal workforce policies and my work as a Member of the @EdWorkforceCmte with members of the Mid-Atlantic Association of Career Schools in Lancaster earlier this week!

Today is #NationalInternDay! Thank you to our great summer interns who helped our offices serve the constituents of Pennsylvania’s 11th Congressional District. Gardner worked in my Lancaster office & Maddie worked in my Washington office. Best wishes on continued future success!

Increased price transparency in health care empowers patients to make informed decisions. I am thankful the @WaysandMeansGOP is advancing these critical patient-centered reforms. Listen to my comments:

Thanks to York County President Commissioner Julie Wheeler, community leaders, and the staff of the York County Conservation District for a great discussion about efforts to improve the environment in York County and policies to improve the upcoming 2023 Farm Bill.

I’m proud to introduce the Main Street Tax Certainty Act. This legislation will help small businesses on main street across the nation invest in their communities, create jobs, and grow. Learn more: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

I appreciated visiting Rexroth Farms in Windsor to discuss federal conservation programs and Congress’s upcoming consideration of the 2023 Farm Bill.

It was great to join WDAC this week to discuss my support for the State of Israel and fall internship opportunities in my offices. Listen in!
Thanks to Hector and Aleish at WLCH Radio Centro for having me back in the studio today to discuss important issues facing our nation and community!
I will always stand with our close friend and ally, Israel. 🇺🇸🇮🇱

My Washington and district offices are seeking interns for the fall! Internships are a great opportunity to see first-hand how Congress operates. Learn more and apply here: smucker.house.gov/services/i…

Yesterday was National Ice Cream Day, but every day is great for ice cream! Did you know Seven Valleys in #PA11 is the birthplace of commercial ice cream production in America? lancasterfarming.com/farming…

It was great to meet with Pennsylvania Farm Bureau President Chris Hoffman and members of the organization to discuss the 2023 Farm Bill. Thanks for visiting Washington!

I supported the FY2024 National Defense Authorization Act because it:
✅ Gives our brave service members the largest pay raise in over 20 years
✅ Ensures our military is equipped to respond to any threat, and
✅ Strengthens oversight of taxpayers’ dollars

PA in FY2021 had nearly $700 million in unspent federal TANF funds. Congress needs to provide states flexibility to innovate & assist those truly in need, while ensuring rigorous accountability of taxpayers’ dollars. Listen to my comments from yesterday’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing
Wishing everyone a very happy All American Pet Photo Day from the furry family members of Team Smucker!

During yesterday’s @WaysandMeansGOP field hearing, I asked fourth-generation dairy farmer Brad Vold about how Canada’s failure to live up to the dairy agreements in the USMCA impacts his family’s farm and farms like his in #PA11 and across the nation. Listen to his response:

Reminder: my office is participating in the 2023 Congressional App Challenge. I’m looking forward to seeing entries from middle and high school students from across #PA11! Learn more: smucker.house.gov/services/c…

.@HouseGOP advanced the REINS Act which gives Congress the final say over major regulations. This legislation is critical to restoring congressional oversight and shielding taxpayers from significant costs and regulatory overreach.  foxnews.com/politics/biden-r…

6/6 -And we can supercharge investment in workforce development programs, career and technical education, and apprenticeship programs by passing my targeted USA Workforce Tax Credit Act. Learn more about this legislation here: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

5/6 - We can take a small step to reduce costs experienced by student loan borrowers by passing my Student Loan Tax Elimination Act, to end origination fees on student loans. Learn more about this bill here: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

4/6 - Colleges, universities, & lenders, must be transparent with students regarding the total cost of a loan & if that degree will help them get a good paying job. Giving students data on outcomes up front will prevent some from taking on too much debt in the first place.

3/6 - Congress and the executive branch should engage in good faith discussions about higher education affordability and investment in critical workforce development programs to connect individuals with great careers.
2/6 - President Biden sidestepped the hard work necessary to address the root of the problem by kowtowing to the most extreme elements of his party.

1/6 - Let’s be clear about one thing: President Biden’s unconstitutional and massive government giveaway would not have resulted in lowering the cost of higher education, which is the real problem to address.
Our thanks go to all of the first responders who arrived on the scene this morning, glad that no one has been reported injured. wgal.com/article/pennsylvani…
Wishing everyone a joyous Independence Day celebration! God Bless America!

With over 10 million jobs available, we should be expanding access to critical career and technical education programs, not limiting it. Proud to join Rep. Max Miller in this letter expressing our concern with Biden administration regulations. maxmiller.house.gov/posts/co…

I joined WDAC this week to discuss how the CHOICE Arrangement Act provides small businesses, self-employed individuals, and workers affordable and flexible health care options. Listen in!
We’re halfway through the year now that June is in the rearview mirror. Watch, like, and share my June in Review video to stay updated on what’s been happening in Congress and in #PA11.
I agree with the SCOTUS decision to strike down POTUS’s unconstitutional debt bailout. Those who choose to take out loans should pay them back.
The latest report from @USCBO highlights the dire need to change the trajectory of our nation’s fiscal future. We can solve this, but we must act with urgency.

It’s National Boys & Girls Club Week! I was pleased to visit the Lancaster @BGCA_Clubs to share summer reading materials from the @librarycongress.  I appreciated discussing youth workforce readiness with BGC of Lancaster CEO Karen Schloer & @LancasterBoard Exec. Dir. Anna Ramos

My bipartisan Primary Care Enhancement Act would remove barriers for individuals with Health Savings Accounts from accessing innovative care models like Direct Primary Care. Learn more about my legislation: lancasteronline.com/news/pol…
2/2 – Learn more about the historical significance of bridge burning courtesy of the Susquehanna National Heritage Area. susqnha.org/riverroots-1863-…

1/2 - Today marks the 160th anniversary of the burning of the Columbia-Wrightsville Bridge which stopped the Confederate Army from advancing further east to Lancaster. Below is an artist’s depiction of the bridge burning, courtesy of the archives of Dickinson College.
Did you know that Hanover has an important place in Civil War history? Learn more about the Battle of Hanover: fox43.com/article/news/local…
It was great to welcome members of the Pennsylvania Rural Letter Carriers Association to Pennsylvania’s 11th Congressional District! Thanks for all you do to keep our communities connected!

This week I joined WDAC to discuss Congress’s passage of the REINS Act and the Congressional App Challenge. Listen in!
Thanks to staff of CNH Industrial of New Holland for visiting with me in Washington to discuss the upcoming 2023 Farm Bill and energy policies.
Today I voted in favor of the Middle Class Borrower Protection Act, to repeal the Biden administration’s socialist fees on creditworthy homebuyers.

I was proud to support legislation introduced by my colleagues on the @WaysandMeansGOP and @EdWorkforceCmte to provide small businesses, self-employed individuals, and workers affordable and flexible health care options. Listen to my remarks:

It is great to see the winning submission from #PA11 in the Congressional Art Competition, “Reader’s Quiet Reflection” on display in the Capitol! This incredible piece of art was created by Anika Hogdon of Solanco High School in Lancaster County.

I appreciated the behind-the-scenes tour of Campbell’s Pepperidge Farm production facility in Denver and the opportunity to meet the hard-working employees. Pennsylvania’s 11th District produces some tasty treats!
Our national debt has eclipsed $32 trillion. Congress urgently needs to begin to bend the curve of our nation’s fiscal trajectory. I’ll continue to fight to return fiscal discipline to Washington.

To all fellow fathers, I’m wishing you a great Father’s Day!
This week I joined WDAC to discuss how I’m advocating for better service and processing times for those seeking passports and reflect on Father’s Day. Listen in!
This week @HouseGOP took a major step to make the government more accountable to the people, by passing the REINS Act which requires congressional approval of any major executive regulation.
It was great to meet with Lancaster City Council Member Janet Diaz and her mother in Washington, thanks for the great discussion!
Thanks to local members of @nfib_pa for visiting me in Washington to discuss policies impacting small businesses in our community!
The REINS Act is a much-needed restoration of congressional oversight in Washington. Read my full statement about supporting this important legislation. smucker.house.gov/media/pres…

I’m proud to announce that my office is joining the 2023 Congressional App Challenge. Middle and high school students can learn more about the competition and register teams here: congressionalappchallenge.us… @CongressionalAC
Happy 248th Birthday to the United States Army! Thanks to all those who are currently serving and those who served our nation!
Today is Flag Day, a day to commemorate and honor the symbol of our nation and the freedoms which we enjoy. Long may our flag wave! God Bless America!🇺🇸

Today, the @WaysandMeansGOP has reasserted Congress’s constitutional duty to regulate international commerce and trade. Thanks to Chairman @RepJasonSmith for his leadership in advancing this bipartisan legislation to strengthen our trade relationship with Taiwan.

2/2 - It was great to meet the members of the Board of Directors including Stewartstown Mayor Brittany Barnette. Thanks for the warm welcome!

1/2 - Thanks to the staff at the Mason-Dixon Public Library in Stewartstown for all you do to provide the community with opportunities to learn and grow. I visited the library to share books from the Library of Congress.

Volunteer firefighters selflessly serve their communities & respond to others in need. Thanks to Shrewsbury Volunteer Fire Company & Chief Dauberman for hosting a meeting with local chiefs from southern York County to discuss federal policies to assist volunteer firefighters.

I appreciated the opportunity to participate in VisionCorps EyeDrop, rappelling down the 10-story Holiday Inn in downtown Lancaster today with Lancaster City Mayor Danene Sorace! Thanks to VisionCorps for the invitation!

By eliminating industry-recognized apprenticeship programs, the Biden admin believes the skills gap isn’t impacting the labor market. Clearly the Biden admin hasn’t spoken with the private sector—finding skilled workers is the no. 1 challenge I hear from businesses in #PA11.

Thanks to member-owners of the Land O’Lakes dairy cooperative, including Steve Harnish of Washington Boro, for meeting with me to discuss the 2023 Farm Bill and federal policies impacting dairy farmers.

The Biden admin requires project labor agreements on federal projects. PLAs increase costs for taxpayers & limit opportunities for the 88.3% of construction workers who choose not to be in a union. This anti-competitive practice is wrong for taxpayers & hardworking Americans.

Great to meet with Luke Brubaker of Brubaker Farms in Mount Joy, a dairy and chicken family-owned operation, to discuss Congress’s upcoming consideration of the 2023 Farm Bill and global food security. Thanks for visiting Luke!
Today marks the 79th anniversary of D-Day. May we always give thanks and honor the service of the members of the Greatest Generation who fought to preserve the freedoms we enjoy.

Did you know that Pennsylvania’s 11th Congressional District is among the top dairy producing congressional districts in the nation? June is National Dairy Month. Thanks to all our hardworking dairy farmers!
Experiencing difficulty with a federal department or agency? Contact my office, we’re here to help. Visit my website to learn more. smucker.house.gov/services/h…
I joined WDAC this week to discuss the Fiscal Responsibility Act and this year’s Congressional Art Competition winner from #PA11. Listen in!

Need a passport for upcoming travel? Don’t delay, apply today! Processing times at the Department of State for routine service are 10-13 weeks and 7-9 weeks for expedited service. Visit the Department of State’s website for forms and more: travel.state.gov/content/tra…

The Fiscal Responsibility Act is an important first step to move America’s finances in the right direction. There’s more work to do and I remain committed to working to bring fiscal discipline to Washington.

June is Alzheimer’s and Brain Awareness Month. As a proud member of the bipartisan Congressional Task Force on Alzheimer’s disease I am proud to fight for legislation to help cure and prevent Alzheimer’s.
May and April are in the rearview mirror and summer is almost officially here. Watch, like, and share my April & May in Review video to stay updated on what’s been happening in Congress and in #PA11.

If you’re having difficulty with a federal department or agency, please contact my office. It would be an honor to assist you. Visit my website to learn more: smucker.house.gov/services/h…

I appreciated receiving a briefing on Penn State Health’s Life Lion program at the Penn State Health Lancaster Medical Center this week. Life Lion serves individuals with critical care transport service across south-central Pennsylvania.

It was great to share books from the Library of Congress with the Lancaster Public Library’s Mountville Branch this week. Thanks for all you do to provide our community with opportunities to learn and grow!
Career and technical education programs are vital and provide individuals the skills they need to succeed. Thanks to WGAL for joining yesterday’s discussion at WLCH and the tour of Tec Centro.

It was great to be back in the WLCH Studios this morning to talk with Carlos, Hector and Aleish. As we observe Career & Technical Education Month, I also appreciated touring and learning about the great workforce development programs offered at Tec Centro in downtown Lancaster.
2/2 - Visit my website for more information: smucker.house.gov/media/blog…

1/2 - Attention Adamstown Borough residents! My office has received an update about postal concerns in your community: residents who are ineligible for street delivery will be provided one free Group E PO Box & customers may request refunds for up to 2-years of PO Box fees paid.

We must change the trajectory of our financial future. @USCBO reported that debt held by the public will eclipse 100% of GDP our nation’s economic output—IN TWO YEARS. By 2053, debt held by the public will eclipse nearly 200% of our nation’s GDP. America needs fiscal discipline.

It was great to meet with team members of United Disability Services to learn how they support individuals with disabilities across 40 counties in Pennsylvania. I especially appreciated learning more about their service dog program. Thanks for all you do!

Valentine’s Day was a sweet day to get a behind-the-scenes tour of Taylor Chip Cookies in Manheim Township to learn more about their tasty treats and their company’s story. Thank you Sara and Doug for a great visit and best wishes for continued success!

Today’s inflation report came in higher than expected with more bad news for American families struggling to make ends meet. Food prices are up 10.1% over last year. Energy prices are up 8.7%. cnbc.com/2023/02/14/consumer…

Today kicks off National Entrepreneurship Week! It’s a time to recognize, encourage, and celebrate the spirit and achievements of entrepreneurs across the nation.
The first month of the year is in the books and 118th Congress is off to a great start. Watch, like, and share the first edition of my new video series recapping each month in Congress!
America must show strength on the global stage. I joined my colleagues by voting to condemn the Chinese Communist Party. Their violation of our nation’s airspace is just their latest offense.

A robust career and technical education (CTE) program can provide students a pathway to lifelong success. Legislation like the PELL Act and my USA Workforce Tax Credit Act would provide additional support for CTE programs. ccdaily.com/2023/02/workforc…

Today, I spoke on the House floor in favor of ending the CDC’s COVID-19 vaccine travel mandate. A Lancaster County native and constituent who is completing his education abroad is unable to move his family home because of this misguided government red tape. Listen to my remarks:

It was an honor to meet with @christianduerr, a Member of the German parliament, the Bundestag, to discuss trade and energy policy, and opportunities to strengthen the ties of friendship between our two nations. Thanks for visiting! Danke schön!
Happy Birthday to my best friend in Congress and neighboring colleague in the House, @RepJohnJoyce!
My reaction to the State of the Union address:

2/2 - @yorkcounty_da @DaveSunday_  is on the frontlines of keeping our community safe, supporting our police, and working hand-in-hand with law enforcement and community organizations to combat the fentanyl and opioid crisis.
1/2 - This evening, my guest to the State of the Union address will be York County District Attorney Dave Sunday.
I appreciated joining the @HouseGOP Media Row this afternoon before the State of the Union this evening.

Great to speak with @Comm_College this morning about the critical role their members will play in providing the next generation of Americans the skills needed to succeed in the workforce. Thanks for the invitation to join you and thanks for all you do!

Great to be outside the beltway to hear directly from real Americans about their struggles and the negative impact of Biden’s policies. @WaysandMeansGOP is holding a field hearing in West Virginia to discuss the state of our economy. Tune in here ⬇️ piped.video/watch?v=Rij2pGhl…
My offices are here to assist you. If you’re experiencing an issue or problem with a federal department, contact my offices. It would be an honor to assist you. smucker.house.gov/services/h…

Proud to support The PELL Act to expand Pell Grant eligibility to high-quality, short-term programs for workers looking to gain skills in high-demand fields. Learn more here⬇️ 
edworkforce.house.gov/news/d…
The @HouseGOP is taking our competitive relationship with China seriously and is developing policies to strengthen our nation and economy.

Pleased to see @USTradeRep @AmbassadorTai take additional steps to support American dairy farmers, by ensuring Canada lives up to their agreements in the USMCA. Dairy farmers in #PA11 and across the country look forward to the opportunity to compete fairly in new markets.
Thanks to students from Lancaster Bible College for visiting our nation’s capital this week. It was great to meet you!
Thanks to Dr. Jonathan Bornman of Lancaster for attending this morning’s National Prayer Breakfast as my guest.
Free enterprise has lifted the most people out of poverty and created the most wealth for the greatest number of people. I proudly condemn socialism.

Energy security is national security. Today’s vote on the Strategic Production Response Act will ensure any future withdrawals of our emergency reserves are met with a proportionate plan to increase domestic production.
It’s an honor to serve on the Ways & Means, Budget, and Education & Workforce Committees for the 118th Congress. My full statement: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…
Today is International Holocaust Remembrance Day. We must never forget. We must stand against hate.

Thanks to Charles from Fawn Grove for meeting with me in Washington yesterday to discuss government pension offset and the windfall elimination provisions. And thank you for your service to our nation!

Children who develop a fondness for reading will be lifelong learners. It was great to visit Kreutz Creek Library in Hellam Township to provide books for their collections from the Library of Congress.
A great education allows students to succeed. Parents deserve a voice in their children’s education.

Glad to see @WaysandMeansGOP Chair @RepJasonSmith leading the charge to investigate COVID unemployment fraud, a national nightmare which cost taxpayers billions. @HouseGOP will exercise robust oversight of taxpayer funds. waysandmeans.house.gov/chair…
I appreciated meeting with faith leaders from Pennsylvania’s 11th District to discuss policies to improve our environment. Thanks for a great discussion!

So shocked and saddened to learn of the tragic passing of York County community and business leaders Tim and Jon Kinsley.  Please join me in keeping their family in our prayers during this extremely difficult time. fox43.com/article/news/local…
Thanks to Joanne Castner for meeting with me to discuss the humanitarian and national security crisis at our nation’s southern border.

2/2 - Our discussion led to many suggestions to combat human trafficking in our community and ways to support survivors. I want to thank all the participants for their efforts and suggestions. Working together, we can address human trafficking in our community.

1/2 - January is National Human Trafficking Prevention Month. I was pleased to host a roundtable with local law enforcement including YoCo DA @DaveSunday_ & @Lancaster_DA Heather Adams, community organizations, victim advocates, @SenatorKristin and @RepGrove.
I’m proud that my pro-life voting record received an A+ Rating from @sbaprolife for the 117th Congress. I will continue to support pro-life legislative policies to protect the unborn.
It was great to be back in the WLCH Radio Centro studio this morning with Hector and Aleish. Thanks for the great discussion!
Inflation has taken its toll on American families. A new study reports the average American family has lost $7,400 as a result of inflation.   foxbusiness.com/politics/ame…

It is an honor and privilege to serve the people of #PA11. Last year my office was able to assist 2,482 individuals with issues they are experiencing with federal departments or agencies. Since 2017, my office has returned $27,655,686 to constituents.
Inflation in December was the second highest level experienced in the last 40 years. Families across the country are still struggling to make ends meet because of Bidenflation.
Proud to be a cosponsor of @RepKatCammack's REINS Act, to restore balance to the regulatory process by requiring Congress to approve any new major regulations. foxnews.com/politics/gop-pla…
Today I voted in favor of the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. In Congress, I will continue to support pro-life policies.

Today is National Milk Day! Did you know, according to the Census of Agriculture conducted by the USDA, that #PA11’s Lancaster County is the leading producer of milk in Pennsylvania? Thanks to all the hardworking dairy farmers!

We must be forward-thinking about our competitive relationship with the Chinese Communist Party. I was proud to support @SpeakerMcCarthy's legislation to create a select committee to work on a bipartisan basis to make policy recommendations to strengthen our nation and economy.

Yesterday, I supported the Family & Small Business Taxpayer Protection Act to stop the Biden administration from hiring 87,000 new IRS agents to target families and small businesses with audits. My full statement: smucker.house.gov/media/pres…
Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. May we always give thanks to those who selflessly serve and keep our communities safe.

If President Biden really wanted to know what was happening at the southern border, his trip would’ve included talking to my colleague @RepTonyGonzales  whose district includes 800 miles of our southern border. Biden’s policies created this humanitarian & national security crisis

We are so very saddened and shocked by the unexpected passing of Judge Shawn Long.  Cindy and I express our deepest and heartfelt condolences to Jessica and the entire family.  Keeping all of you in our thoughts and prayers.
It is an honor and a privilege to serve the constituents of Pennsylvania’s 11th Congressional District. smucker.house.gov/media/pres…
Our prayers are with you for a full and speedy recovery.

Every day a handful of my colleagues won’t join the overwhelming majority of the Republican Conference in supporting Kevin McCarthy for Speaker is a day that we’re not doing the work we should be doing for the American people. lancasteronline.com/news/pol…
3/3 - I call on my colleagues to unite behind Kevin and get to work on the agenda supported by our constituents.

2/3 - Instead, a handful of people are keeping the House from getting down to business to secure our border, eliminate wasteful spending, and hold the Biden administration accountable for disastrous government overreach.
1/3 - I was proud to vote for Kevin McCarthy for Speaker today. He is supported by an overwhelming majority of the Republican Members-elect and should be Speaker now.
Wishing you and your family a happy, healthy, and prosperous 2023!
